image.altText: A head and shoulders shot of a man with short hair looking downwards while walking outside.

props.synopsis: A sex predator who pretended to be a teenage YouTube star to blackmail hundreds of children into performing sexual acts is sentenced to 17 years in jail.

title.children: 'No comparable case': Man who posed as fake Youtube star to lure children into performing sex acts jailed for 17 years

image.altText: man wearing hat and black shirt

props.synopsis: Visitors hoping to enjoy a little winter sunshine in northern WA instead swelter through unseasonal heat, as tour operators seek workarounds to keep them cool and safe.

title.children: Tourists caught out as temperatures skyrocket 'out of control' across the Kimberley

image.altText: A crowd of people in a hall holding up stubs of paper during a vote.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of Albany residents have voted to restrict children accessing to sex education books in the city's library.

title.children: Claims of misinformation and conspiracies as WA city debates access to sex education books

image.altText: A football player for the West Coast Eagles kicks the ball.

props.synopsis: West Coast Eagles defender Tom Barrass has told the club he wants to be traded to be Hawthorn.

title.children: West Coast Eagles defender Tom Barrass requests trade to Hawthorn

image.altText: A sparkling sky with blue and purple tones. A brown sign says River Murray International Dark Sky Reserve

props.synopsis: It's been a year-long legal stoush between the WA Tourism Commission and a small South Australian council over an attempt to trademark the term "Dark Sky Festival".Â

title.children: Who owns the Dark Sky? Country council wins trademark battle against Tourism WA

image.altText: An adult lies in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis:
How do you decide what is essential for you â and what isn't â when it comes to private health insurance?

Â

title.children: Things to consider when weighing up private health insurance against the cost-of-living

image.altText: A close-up of a customer pumping fuel into a car at a service station.

props.synopsis: Escalating geopolitical tensions threaten to send the price of oil soaring and it could mean bad news for Australians at the petrol pump.Â

title.children: The price of oil spiked overnight amid global tensions. What does it mean for Australian motorists?

image.altText: Group of protesters with one holding a sign 'right to strike'.

props.synopsis: Tens of thousands of tradies across the country have walked off the job in protest against the federal government's takeover of the construction arm of the CFMEU.

title.children: Prime minister warns of 'consequences' as thousands of CFMEU workers strike across Australia

image.altText: A woman stands by a street, as a bike and cars rush past.

props.synopsis: As the Middle East teeters on the precipice of regional war, ABC's Four Corners went where few Western journalists are allowed and got a glimpse of the regime's power.

title.children: Tensions in the Middle East are set to explode. Iran is counting down the days

image.altText: The vascular system of a piece of wood infested by shot hole borer beetles

props.synopsis: The Shire of Harvey admits to mistakenly saying it had detected shot-hole borers in its local government area, a species that has killed thousands of trees across Perth.

title.children: Politicians under fire for false social media posts about invasive beetle

image.altText: A woman with an umbrella walks in the University of Sydney quadrangle.

props.synopsis: Education Minister Jason Clare has announced his much-anticipated overall limit for international students starting in 2025, with individual caps to be set for providers.Â

title.children: International student commencements to be capped at 270,000 next year

image.altText: Andrew Brayshaw shares a hug with Caleb Serong

props.synopsis: The premiership dreams of 10 clubs are officially over, but that doesn't mean their seasons are done. Here is a look at a to-do list for each of the teams that failed to qualify for this year's AFL finals.

title.children: Season over? Not quite â the big decisions facing each club that missed the AFL finals

image.altText: A graphic of two women in graduation outfits, against a purple background with a red graph line over the top.

props.synopsis: The international education market is big business, particularly in Australia. As the government moves forward with the most significant crackdown on the sector in decades, we take a look at just how massive the industry really is.

title.children: The true scale of Australia's international student industry â in four charts

image.altText: John Peros wearing sunglasses leaving the Mackay court house.

props.synopsis: John Perosis' defamation case against Shandee Blackburn's sister, investigative journalist Hedley Thomas, and News Corp Australia has been dismissed.Â

title.children: True crime podcast did not 'seriously harm' reputation of Shandee Blackburn's former partner, judge finds

image.altText: A composite of Kamala Harris and Donald Trump.

props.synopsis: There's an eerie quiet about what potentially is looming as a future crisis point for the US economy. Neither party is addressing America's burgeoning debt levels and the yawning gap between its income and its outlays.

title.children: Trump and Harris go quiet on America's biggest economic issue

image.altText: A mother is looking down at her premature baby daughter and smiling, while cuddling her

props.synopsis: A widely used test that determines whether women are in premature labour has been discontinued, and doctors say losing access could put further strain on emergency transport services in rural and remote areas.

title.children: After this baby was born at 27 weeks, a test that helped ensure its safe arrival is being discontinued

image.altText: A family sits on a mat inside a subway, with a young girl with her hair plaited looking directly at the camera

props.synopsis: First-hand accounts of the latest attack on Kyiv detail sirens blaring for 10 hours and explosions overhead, as Russia targets the country's power grid.

title.children: Ukrainians emerge from shelters to find cities plunged into darkness after latest Russian attack

image.altText: University of Adelaide Vice-Chancellor Professor Peter Rathjen

props.synopsis: A University of Tasmania employee is alleging the former vice-chancellor groped her on three separate occasions without her consent.

title.children: UTAS employee suing former vice-chancellor Peter Rathjen

image.altText: Jim Chalmers wears a navy suit, looking solemnly off camera.

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers has accused the Opposition Leader Peter Dutton of deliberately and "pathologically" seeking to divide the nation after two weeks of heated debate over Gaza visas.Â

title.children: Chalmers ramps up attacks on 'dangerous' and 'divisive' Dutton

image.altText: Stephen Mitchell sits at a cafe holding a take-away coffee cup.

props.synopsis: A judge who calculated former national rock climbing coach Stephen Mitchell's sentence for child sex abuse on a maximum sentence much higher than what applied at the time of the offences is urged to maintain the over 13-year sentence anyway.

title.children: Canberra judge urged to maintain convicted child sex offender's 13-year sentence

image.altText: Two satellite images side by side from 2020 and 2024. The latter shows an area of forest has been cleared.

props.synopsis: European supermarkets won't buy beef from Brazil due to concerns about land clearing in the Amazon. Now conservationists are urging Coles and Woolworths to follow suit to combat deforestation in Australia.

title.children: 16,000 hectares of forests found flattened on beef farms and 'people don't even know it's happening'

image.altText: Oasis credit Dave Hogan GettyImages

props.synopsis: After 15 years of trading insults and refuting any suggestion they might reform, Liam and Noel Gallagher will reunite Oasis to headline a series of live shows next year.

title.children: Oasis are reforming â here's everything you need to know

image.altText: A charred vehicle sits in a field of green grass.

props.synopsis: The most aggressive and dominant ethnic Baloch armed group has launched a highly organised series of attacks on police stations, railway lines and highways as part of its fight for independence and to push out Chinese-backed projects.

title.children: What is Operation 'Dark Windy Storm'? The audacious attacks that took a Pakistani province by surprise

image.altText: A machine with many yellow circles inside a white background.

props.synopsis: Scientists have yet to find evidence of WIMPs â one of the main contenders for dark matter â in the most sensitive test yet made. We explain what the new results mean.

title.children: The world's most sensitive detector has found no sign of dark matter. So where is it?

image.altText: A middle-aged man in a dark jumper sits at a desk in a conference room.

props.synopsis: Byron Shire Mayor Michael Lyon has lost an application to stop the media reporting on allegations he assaulted his wife. The revelation comes weeks ahead of local government elections.

title.children: Byron mayor identified in domestic assault case

image.altText: Four remote voting stations next to each other.

props.synopsis: Nearly two-thirds of enrolled voters in some remote Northern Territory electorates didn't vote in the 2024 election. We asked Indigenous Territorians why voter turnout was so poor.

title.children: Hurt after failed Voice referendum linked to low remote voter turnout in NT election

image.altText: Two woman standing in front of a conservatory wall with flowers.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's Premier has signed a new deal with two ex-Jacqui Lambie Network MPs, as their former colleague describes them as "more Liberal than JLN".

title.children: Tasmanian Premier signs new deal with ex-Lambie MPs, as Jenner warns of 'line you can't cross'

image.altText: Photo of smiling man with black jumper and beard.

props.synopsis: Giuliano Pirone collapsed in a shower after an early morning session at a Perth 24-hour gym and was only found that night after his mother raised the alarm.

title.children: Bodybuilder in coma after collapsing in gym shower and left undiscovered for 15 hours with water running

image.altText: A woman wearing a blue burqa covering shields her eyes from the sun and camera while she walks in the street

props.synopsis: Virtue laws introduced by the Taliban ban women from speaking or showing their faces in public as a senior UN official called it an extension of the "already intolerable restrictions" on Afghan women.

title.children: 'Sound of a female voice' banned in public across Afghanistan as UN decries virtue laws

image.altText: A young woman with dark hair, and wearing a sleeveless top, smiles for the camera in a head-and-shoulders photo.

props.synopsis: Kelly Wilkinson told her sister she feared for her life and wanted "someone to know" she'd allegedly been repeatedly raped by her estranged husband Brian Earl Johnston. A court has heard he admitted to the offences, saying he'd been drunk.

title.children: Kelly Wilkinson's killer Brian Earl Johnston faces committal over rape charges

image.altText: A weather map showing high temperatures in Australia's north

props.synopsis: Temperatures across Western Australia's Kimberley exceed 40 degrees Celsius, establishing a new national record for winter temperatures.

title.children: Unseasonal heat breaks Australia's winter temperature record as Kimberley hits 41.6C

image.altText: A smiling little girl with fair hair. She is being held by a person whose face has been blurred.

props.synopsis: Detectives say 12-year-old Tiffani Scholten was "extremely emaciated" when paramedics were called to her family's Gold Coast home in 2022. Today her mother and her stepfather were charged with murder.

title.children: Gold Coast mother, stepfather charged with murder of 12-year-old daughter

image.altText: A bowl of spaghetti with chickpea sauce, topped with torn basil, a quick pantry recipe that's vegan.

props.synopsis: Let's be honest, cooking during the week can be a slog. If you're looking for inspiration and ease, here are three weeknight dinners you can look forward to all day.Â

title.children: Easy weeknight dinners to look forward to all day

image.altText: A woman in a race wheelchair

props.synopsis:
This year's Paralympics play host to more female athletes than ever before â but putting together quotas and prioritising medal events has been described as "the biggest jigsaw puzzle".

Â

title.children: There'll be 80 more female athletes at the Paralympics in Paris, but some say participation needs to change 'at a grassroots level'
